00014 // .NAME vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWriteStructuredPoints - 
00015 // .SECTION Description
00016 // This sub-object is specific to each
00017 // type of volume that needs to be read in.  This can be used
00018 // to clean up the special cases which handle
00019 // volumes of various types, such as dicom, header, etc.  In
00020 // future these things can be moved here.  Each read/write 
00021 // sub-object corresponds to a vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode subclass.
00022 // These subclasses write any needed info in the MRML file.
00023 //
00024 
00025 #ifndef __vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWriteStructuredPoints_h
00026 #define __vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWriteStructuredPoints_h
00027 
00028 #include "vtkObject.h"
00029 #include "vtkSlicer.h"
00030 #include "vtkMrmlVolumeNode.h"
00031 #include "vtkStructuredPoints.h"
00032 #include "vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite.h"
00033 
00034 class VTK_SLICER_BASE_EXPORT vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWriteStructuredPoints : public vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite 
00035 {
00036   public:
00037   static vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWriteStructuredPoints *New();
00038   vtkTypeMacro(vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWriteStructuredPoints,vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite);
00039   void PrintSelf(ostream& os, vtkIndent indent);
00040   
00041   // Return code indicates success (1) or error (0)
00042   int Read(vtkMrmlVolumeNode *node, vtkImageSource **output);
00043   int Write(vtkMrmlVolumeNode *node, vtkImageData *input);
00044 
00045   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00046   // Specifics for reading/writing each type of volume data
00047   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00048 
00049   // Subclasses must fill these in.
00050   vtkSetStringMacro(FileName);
00051   vtkGetStringMacro(FileName);
00052 
00053 protected:
00054   vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWriteStructuredPoints();
00055   ~vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWriteStructuredPoints();
00056   vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWriteStructuredPoints(const vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWriteStructuredPoints&) {};

00058 
00059   char *FileName;
00060 
00061 };
